Prologue: ^The tides of the Vespian Sea throw the Ivaran flagship to near tipping points.
^Treasures from the ship's hold are scattered and thrown around on the deck.
^Crewmates are dragged along the deck with each wave, throwing them off balance, even flinging some overboard.
^Through the sounds of the crashing wave you hear an order ring out across the deck.

c-0: ^ You scramble to stuff your pockets with as much gold as you can cling on to, before diving into the rowboat.
^"Private Draven! Forget the treasure and help your crew!" screams Captain Joran from the ship's helm.
^You ignore his orders and begin lowering the rowboat.
c-1: ^ You grab Private Varker and pull him into the rowboat with you.
^You both work together to lower the rowboat onto the ocean.
c-2: ^ You turn your back to the deck of the ship and leap into the rowboat.
^The remaining crew watch as you struggle to lower the rowboat, their faces stricken with shock.
^"Private Draven took one of the boats for himself!" Screams a crewmate whilst you lower the rowboat onto the sea.
^"Coward would save his own skin than the rest of us!" Shouts another as you descend.
g-0: ^As you lower the rowboat into the roaring waves, the ropes snap under the strain of the buckling ship. The splash of the impact drenches

^The ocean smothers you with towering waves, with only the crow's nest of the ship visible. With each flash of lightning, you and the ship drift further apart, until a colossal wave charges you, knocking you off the rowboat.

b: ^As you fall beneath the waves, you can see gold coins, ingots and jewels drifting down alongside you.
^As you fall beneath the waves, for a moment you can see Varker trying to reach out to grab you, but to no avail.
^As you fall beneath the waves, you can see the bottom of the rowboat drift away.

PrologueEnd: ^Eventually, the sheer force of the sea batters out whatever air remains in your lungs. As your eyes start to close, you are carried away by the waves...

BeachStart: ^You open your eyes to find yourself along a small shoreline.

b: ^Nearby is the rowboat you were on before falling into the Vespian Sea, with something shining in your eye from the sunlight.
^As you stand up, you see Varker rushing to you.

SavedCrewmate: ^"Oh thank goodness! I was starting to worry that you wouldn't wake up!"

c-0: ^ You ask Varker if he has any idea where you are.
^"I was hoping you would know. Geography was never my strong suit at the academy."
^"All I know is we are a long way from Ivara."
c-1: ^ You ask Varker how long you were passed out.
^"I'm not too sure, I've only been awake myself for a few moments."
c-2: ^ You tell Varker you should both start looking around the area.
^"Sounds like a good idea, maybe something from the ship drifted ashore."

FoundCaptain: ^Getting a closer look, you see that it's Captain Joran! He seems to be passed out, much like you were moments ago.

c-0: ^ You rummage through Joran's pockets looking for anything useful.

b: ^"Draven what are you doing?! You're already picking his pockets!? He may still be alive!" exclaims Varker while you rummage.

c-0: ^You manage to find a pouch of gold coins and a strange talisman with a clasp at its base.
^ You put the pouch and talisman back into Joran's pockets.
c-1: ^ You slot the pouch and talisman into your own pockets
^You put your fingers to Joran's neck, trying to find some sort of pulse...
^No pulse is felt on your fingers.
c-2: ^ You stand up to walk away from Joran, leaving him leant against the rocks.

b: ^"You're just going to walk away?" Varker questioned.
^You tell Varker that there isn't much else that you can really do.
^"Well we can't just leave him here!"
^You and Varker continue to argue until a heavy cough and sputter interrupt you both.
^As you turn to walk away, you feel something grasp at your leg.
^You tell Varker he has no pulse and work together to resuscitate him.
^You immediately attempt to resuscitate him, hopeful of the chance he will live.

AssistCaptain: ^Eventually Joran lets out a cough, sputtering out seawater from his mouth.

b: ^"Draven? Varker? Thank the gods someone else survived that damned mess." Joran coughs as more seawater drips down his chin.
^"You need to get back to Ivara and explain what happened to the council."
^"You need to take this aswell." Joran reaches into his pocket.

^"Where is it? Oh no, no, no!" Joran panics, checking his other pockets.

^You show Joran the talisman you found from his pocket, much to his relief.

^"Oh thank goodness! I thought it had been lost to the Vespian Sea!"
^Joran pulls out a strange talisman with a clasp at its base and stretches his hand out.
^Varker takes the talisman from Joran and tucks it in his pocket.
^"Probably best that I hold on to this." He says while sneaking a judging glance at you as he does so.
^You take the talisman from Joran's hand.
^You clutch the talisman tightly before putting it in your pocket.
^Joran lets out a heavy cough and sputter has he holds your leg.
^"You dishonourable thief! Men were drowning while you lined your pockets!"
^"You're the last person I was hoping would survive but nonetheless..."
^"You need to get back to Ivara and explain what happened to the council."
^"You need to take this aswell." Joran reaches into his pocket.

^"Where is it? Oh no, no, no!" Joran panics, checking his other pockets.

^You show Joran the talisman you found, much to his relief.

^"Oh thank goodness! I thought it had been lost to the Vespian Sea!"

^"But knowing you, you probably picked this from my pocket before I woke up."
^Joran pulls out a strange talisman with a clasp at its base and stretches his hand out.
^You take the talisman from Joran's hand.
^You clutch the talisman tightly before putting it in your pocket.
^Joran lets out a heavy cough and sputter has he holds your leg.
^"You damned coward! Leaving the rest of us to drown!" He sputters.
^"You're the last person I was hoping would survive but nonetheless..."
^"You need to get back to Ivara and explain what happened to the council."
^"You need to take this aswell." Joran reaches into his pocket.

^"Where is it? Oh no, no, no!" Joran panics, checking his other pockets.

^You show Joran the talisman you found from his pocket, much to his relief.

^"Oh thank goodness! I thought it had been lost to the Vespian Sea!"
^Joran pulls out a strange talisman with a clasp at its base and stretches his hand out.
^You take the talisman from Joran's hand.
^You clutch the talisman tightly before putting it in your pocket.

CaptainWakes: ^"Whatever you do, do not let anyone get that talisman. Take it back to Ivara where it is safe."
^"I will stay here for a while longer and try to regain my strength."
^"Good Luck..." Joran utters as he drifts into slumber.

b: ^A golden crest bearing the emblem of the Ivaran Consulate, found washed up on the beach. Usually they are worn by captains of the Ivaran Fleet.
^You pick up an Ivaran crest off the ground.
^An ingot of gold with the emblem of the Ivaran Consulate stamped on the middle. Found in the rowboat on the beach.
^You take a gold ingot from the rowboat.
^A small, but hefty pouch of gold coins you picked from Joran's pockets.

^A strange talisman given to you by Captain Joran on the beach. Its shape is not recognizable as anything from any of the 5 continents. A golden clasp can be seen at the base, but it does not seem to budge, no matter the force used.
^A worn dagger you purchased from Helmund in Villion Forest. Its blade is slightly chipped and the leather handle has shown some age.
^A small bundle of food rations you bought from Helmund in Villion Forest.

CrossRoads: ^You come to a split in the road.
^The sign next to you says the left path will take you to "Teveran".
^the right path says it will take you to "Villion Forest".

b: ^"With there being 2 paths, do you think it's best for us to split up?" Varker asks.

c-0: ^ You decide to split up and go down different paths.
^"Alright, you choose a path and I'll go down the other one."
c-1: ^ You decide to stay together and it's too risky to separate.
^"That may be best, safety in numbers until we're better equipped."

c-0: ^ You choose to take the path going left.

b: ^"Alright, you head to Teveran and see what you find."
^"I'll go into Villion Forest, might eventually lead to something that will help us get home."
^"Alright, let's head to Teveran! I don't trust going into a forest in an unknown land."
^You choose to take the path to Teveran.

c-1: ^ You choose to take the path going right.

b: ^"Alright, you head to Villion Forest and see where you end up."
^"I'll go to Teveran and see what's over there. Sounds like a town or something."
^"Alright, let's head into Villion Forest! Normally I would avoid forests but it might lead us somewhere that helps get us home."
^You choose to take the path to Villion Forest.
^"I should keep looking around." You say to yourself.
^You stop and notice that this isn't the correct path.

BrokenWagon: ^You come across a broken wagon near the split in the road.

b:
^"This wasn't here earlier..." says Varker.

^"What do you think happened? Especially to the driver and horse."

^You can only shrug your shoulders at Varker, no clear answer can be given from just a wreckage.

^You wonder what happened to the driver and their horse.

^The wagon wreck does not give a clear indicator to their fates.

ArrivalByMerchant: ^You ride in the back of Helmund's wagon towards Teveran.
^Eventually the wagon comes to a stop and Helmund knocks on the wagon door.
^"We're here, come on out!" he tells you through the wagon door.

b:
^You lightly knock on the door.



^No response.

^You knock again on the door.



^No response again.
^"WILL YOU GO AWAY!?" screams a villager from inside.

^You lightly knock on the door.



^No response.

^You knock again on the door.



^No response again.

^You approach to the worker at the docks.

^"Dockyard's closed. Nothin' going in or outta this dock."

^You approach the worker again.

^"I already told ya, dock's closed. Now get lost."
^You approach the worker for a third time.

^Varker turns to you.

^"Well, this village seems to be pretty empty, not to mention unkind to outsiders."

^"Maybe we should head to Villion Forest and see what's over there?"

^You find that there isn't much else to do in Teveran.

^Perhaps finding Varker in Villion Forest may be better for now.

^You find that there isn't much else to do in Teveran.

^Maybe going to Villion Forest will yield better results.
^You start to make your way to the forest.
^You start to make your way to the forest.

^"Well I guess grave diggers already ransacked this place."

^You tell Varker that the coffin is completely empty, there is no body.

^"I guess you have a point, but why would someone steal a corpse?"

^You look inside the coffin only to find nothing but dust and dirt littering the bottom of it.

^You ponder whether grave diggers have been here, yet why they would steal the corpse itself leaves you bewildered.

CultAttack: ^"Get 'em boyz!" shrieks a voice behind you as something smashes against the back of your head, knocking you briefly unconcious.
^As you start to regain conciousness, you can hear bickering nearby.
^"Let's just gut 'em now! What use are they?"
^"You stupid, ya git? They might get us the gem thing the boss has been wantin' from the crypt here!"
^As your eyes open, you see a gang of goblins surrounding you.

b:
^You quickly reach for the dagger on your belt, but grasp at nothing.

^"Lookin for this?" taunts one of the goblins, dangling the dagger by its handle while the others laugh.
^"So you and your friend there might be of use to us."
^"Which one of you lads wants to go get a shiny thing from the crypt?" One of them asks.
^Varker yelps to the goblins "Make him do it, I've got useful information your boss might want!"
^You stare at Varker with an enraged yet shocked face.
^"Wow, this git was quick to throw you in the mud, Ivaran!"

c-0: ^ You reluctantly agree to be sent into the crypt.
^"Good lad!" boasts one of the goblins "As long as you come back with the shiny, we might let ya go."
c-1: ^ You counter Varker by demanding to be taken yourself.

c-0: ^ You show off the talisman to the goblins, clutching it tightly.
^Varker scorns you, "You idiot! Joran said we had to keep it safe!"
^"Quiet ya idiot!" shrieks one of the goblins at Varker.
^"Oi! Ain't that one of the shinies the boss is lookin for?"
^You tell them if they take you to the boss, you'll give it to them.
^"How come we don't just kill you and take it?"
^You quickly come up with the lie that without you, the talisman's special ability can't be harnessed.
^"How do you know, ya git? Only the boss knows about these shinies!"
^"You wanna be the one to tell him you got him a shiny that don't work?"
^"And get me head smashed? No way!"
^You awkwardly stand there as they start bickering with each other again.
^"Alright Ivaran, we'll take you to the boss. Get Movin!"
c-1: ^ You lie to the goblins that you are a captain of the Ivaran Fleet.
^"He's lying!" Varker interjects, "He's not the captain, we're both privates!"
^"You got anything to prove you are the 'Captain'?"

c-0: ^ You show the crest to the band of goblins.
^The goblins gawk at it, bewildered by it.
^You explain that only captains have this crest as proof of their rank.
^"He found that on the beach we washed up on!" Varker interrupts.
c-1: ^ You tell the goblins that you have no physical proof.
^"See? He was lying! As if someone like him would be a captain!" says Varker.
^"So you don't have proof, just wastin our time!"
^"Get him in the crypt boys, I'm tired of the Ivaran's yappin!"

b: ^"I'll go, send me in." Says Varker.

c-0: ^ You stay quiet, letting Varker offer himself to delve into the crypt.
c-1: ^ You interject and try to convince the goblins to send you instead.
^"I don't trust both of ya goin in! Might scurry out somewhere else like rats."
^"I'll let a coin decide who goes in."
^The goblin flicks a coin high into the air.

b: ^"Okay Ivaran, you got two options here."
^"Go in that crypt and get us the shiny our boss wants..."
^"Or get killed 'ere and we'll find someone else to get it."

c-0: ^ You reluctantly agree to go in the crypt
^"Good lad!" boasts one of the goblins, "As long as you come back with the shiny, we might let ya go."
c-1: ^ You demand the goblins that they take you to their boss instead.
^You lie that you are a captain of the Ivaran fleet.

c-0: ^You show the crest to the band of goblins.
^The goblins gawk at it, bewildered by it.
^You explain that only captains have this crest as proof of their rank.
c-1: ^ You grab the talisman from your pocket and show it to the goblins, clenching it with your hand.
^"Oi! Ain't that one of the shinies the boss is lookin for?"
^You tell them if they take you to the boss, you'll give it to them.
^"How come we don't just kill you and take it?"
^You quickly come up with the lie that without you, the talisman's special ability can't be harnessed.
^"How do you know, ya git? Only the boss knows about these shinies!"
^"You wanna be the one to tell him you got him a shiny that don't work?"
^"And get me head smashed? No way!"
^You awkwardly stand there as they start bickering with each other again.
^"Alright Ivaran, we'll take you to the boss. Get Movin!"
c-2: ^ You tell the goblins that you have no physical proof.
^"So you don't have proof, just wastin our time!"
^"Get him in the crypt boys, I'm tired of the Ivaran's yappin!"

VarkerAttacked: ^As you enter the graveyard you see Varker being surrounded by a band of goblins.
^They appear to be interrogating him and gesturing towards a crypt.

c-0: ^ You attempt to sneak up and ambush the goblins.
^They all quickly turn and stare at you crouched near the ground.
c-1: ^ You keep hiding from the goblins and wait to see what happens.

b: ^As you watch, you see a goblin reach into Varker's pocket and pull out the talisman he took from Joran!
^The goblin shoves it into their own pocket, and begin to march him down the path towards the hills.
^As you watch, the goblins start to push Varker towards the crypt.
^The goblins push open the heavy crypt doors and force Varker inside before following after him.
^You sneak up to the crypt entrance and can see the faint torch light up the walls from around a corner.
^You follow the goblin group and Varker into the crypt, wondering what they are doing in there...
^"We're wastin time here!" screeches one of the goblins.
^"Send this one into the crypt!" pointing towards you.
^"This one comes with us." pointing to Varker.
^The goblins prod you towards the crypt, with others pushing the heavy stone doors open.
^All they give you is a lit torch.
^Once open, you are prodded further inside and the doors begin to close.
^As the doors close, you get one last glance at Varker, who looks back with an air of worry for your safety.
^Once fully shut, you are plunged into darkness, the torch granting only a short view around you.
^The goblins prod you towards the crypt, with others pushing the heavy stone doors open.
^All they give you is a lit torch.
^Once open, you are prodded further inside and the doors begin to close.
^Once fully shut, you are plunged into darkness, the torch granting only a short view around you.
^You keep yourself down low and try to follow.
^Wherever they are going, you will find out where they are taking Varker...
^"Chuck him in the crypt already, there's still the shiny in there we gotta get."
^The goblins prod Varker towards the crypt, prodding him inside and throwing a torch at him.
^As the crypt doors close, Varker gives you one last glance.
^The goblins begin marching you down the path towards the hills...
^"Alright, send that one into the crypt." Orders one of the goblins, pointing at Varker.
^The goblins prod Varker towards the crypt, prodding him inside and throwing a torch at him.
^As the crypt doors close, Varker gives you one last glance.
^"You're comin with us." says another goblin to you.
^The goblins begin marching you down the path towards the hills...
^"Alright ,Ivaran, we'll take you to the boss."
^"But if our boss don't like ya, you're becoming our battle-boars' next meal."
^The goblins form around you and prod you to start moving down the path towards the hills.
^You begin walking, onwards to meet the goblins' boss...

IncomingNoise: ^As you walk down the path, you can hear the trotting of hooves and crashing of trees.
^While it comes closer you see the silhouette of a wagon in the distance.

b: ^"I don't like that. What do we do?" Varker asks.

c-0: ^ You quickly make a dash for the brush of the forest

b: ^, with Varker quickly following behind you

c-1: ^ You stand in the road, ready for whatever is approaching ahead

b: ^You tell Varker to stand his ground, but to be ready for anything.
^As the wagon approaches, you can make out what seems to be the average peasant.
^The sight puts you at ease as they start to slow down and stop next to you.

HideFromNoise: ^As you hide in the bushes, a horse and cart come to a stop just a few feet from you

b:
^Varker whispers to you "They're right in front of us..."

^"Do you think it's worth showing ourselves?"

^"They might get the wrong idea but they could help us."
^Do you reveal yourself or keep hiding?

c-0: ^ You keep as still as you can be, waiting for the wagon to continue on its journey.
^The person at the front turns their head, scanning the treeline.
^They focus heavily in your direction, perhaps noticing you.
^Just as though it seems you're spotted, they turn back and continue their journey.
^You wait for some time to make sure they have gone far enough away.
^You step out from the forest and back onto the forest path.

b: ^You agree with Varker that they may be helpful, and you stand to walk towards the stranger.
^Varker whispers to you "Even if they try something its two against one" as he follows you.
^You stand to walk towards the merchant, brushing pass the grass and dead trees.
^You greet the stranger as you proceed, the stranger spooked by your approach.
^"Woah! What do you think you're doing just jumping out of the forest like that!?" The stranger screamed.
^"Seems all too convenient, I barely made it past some trees as they fell nearly on top of me!"
^Varker snaps back "HEY! We are no thieves! We don't even know where we are!"
^"Can't you see that our clothes are soaked with seawater?!"

c-0: ^ You attempt to calm Varker down.
^"You're telling ME to calm down?! This man is slandering us!"
^You calmly explain the situation to the stranger, informing them about the storm and what happened.
c-1: ^ You attempt to calm the stranger down
^"Don't you tell me to calm down! You're the ones skulking out of the woods!"
^You calmly explain the situation to the stranger, informing them about the storm and what happened.

c-0: ^You calmly explain the situation to the stranger, informing them about the storm and what happened.
^The stranger becomes less tense, but still on their guard "Ah, an unfortunate bit of business for you. My apologies."
c-1: ^You interrupt the stranger and admonish them for these slanderous allegations before explaining your situation.
^You explain to the stranger what happened in the storm and how you wound up here.
^"I'm just calling it how I see it, but I guess most thieves wouldn't care this much about being called thieves.

b: ^"Well hello there, not often I find travellers on these roads." says the stranger.
^"Pretty convenient you're here right after those trees back there nearly collapsed on me and my wagon."

^"But I'm sure if you were bandits your clothes wouldn't be damp and reek of the sea."

^Varker explains "We were sailing across the Vespian Sea when we were hit by a tremendous storm."

^"Then again, you appear to be alone and your clothes are soaked through."

^You explain to the stranger what happened in the storm and how you wound up here.

^You also mention that you and Varker had split at the crossroads.

^"Ah, I see. So you and your friend aren't from around here."

^"Then again, you appear to be alone and your clothes are soaked through."

^You explain to the stranger what happened in the storm and how you wound up here.

^"Ah, I see. A bad bit of business then."
^"I'm Helmund, just a travelling merchant trying to get by. What can I do for you?"
^"What else can I do for you?"

c-0: ^"You boys really are lost, huh. You're in the south of Aerdoros."
^"If you are from Ivara, then I'm afraid you are far from home."
c-1: ^"Well I'm on my way to Teveran! I will see what I can sell to its people then continue to the next."
^ You ask the stranger if you can travel with them to where they are going.

b:
^"Normally I would happily welcome you aboard, but you just came skulking out of the forest."

^"No offense to you sir, but that seems very suspicious to me."
^"You ready to head out? Or you still got something else to do first?"

c-0: ^"Alright, hop on board and we'll get going!

c-2: ^ You ask the merchant for anything they would be willing to trade any of their wares.

b: ^Hmm, alright, but I charge a pretty high price.
^Of course! I only have a few wares for sale though.

c-3: ^ You tell Helmund you will continue into the forest.

b: ^"Well, I'll be on my way as well then."
^"Word of advice, try not to be as conspicuous if you have nothing to hide."
^"Personally I wouldn't stick around this forest for too long."

c-3: ^Helmund rides onwards as you continue further into the forest.

b: ^"What else would you like to trade for?"
^"What would you like to trade for?"
^"For the dagger, it'll take quite alot of gold if you want it."

c-0: ^ You offer a gold pouch in return for the dagger.
^"Hmm, Ivaran gold. I would be crazy not to accept this trade."
^"I won't ask how you came to acquire this, but here you go."

b: ^"I can trade the dagger for some gold if you happen to have any on you."

c-0: ^ You offer a gold pouch in return for the dagger.
^"Well this trade seems all too good to be true!"
^"I won't ask where you got this, but I'll happily give you the dagger for it!"
^You exchange the gold ingot for the merchant's dagger, both of you examining the respective items.
c-1: ^ You offer a gold pouch in return for the dagger.
^"Ah, a hefty pouch of gold. This is suitable enough, here's the dagger."

c-0: ^ You offer a gold pouch in return for some food rations.
^"Well...it is quite a hefty pouch of gold. This will do, here's the food."
^ You offer a gold pouch in return for some food rations.
^"Ah, a hefty pouch of gold. This is suitable enough, here's some food."
c-1: ^ You offer the crest in return for some food rations.
^"A crest? How is this worth anything?"
^You explain that only captains of the Ivaran Fleet have this crest as proof of their rank.
^"Oh...well it's not very often you find one of these."
^"I'm sure there is a collector out there that may pay a pretty price for this. Here's the food in exchange for it."
